definition: A term used to describe the ability of an organism or system to withstand or defend against the harmful effects of external factors, such as diseases, drugs, or environmental conditions. It is commonly used in the context of biology, medicine, and agriculture to refer to the capacity of an organism or crop to resist or tolerate certain diseases, pests, or adverse conditions.

examples.german: Die Resistenz gegen Antibiotika nimmt zu.
Die Pflanzen haben eine nat체rliche Resistenz gegen Sch채dlinge entwickelt.
examples.english: The plants have developed a natural resistance to pests.

examples.english: Resistance to heat is an important property of this material.

examples.german: Die Resistenz gegen Krankheiten kann genetisch bedingt sein.
examples.english: Resistance to diseases can be genetically determined.

examples.english: Resistance to chemicals was tested in the laboratory.
